answers.text: the Joint Declaration on the Doctrine of Justification

qas.question: Who rejects the statement signed in 1999?
Who adopted the Joint Declaration in 2006?

answers.text: delegates to the World Methodist Conference

qas.question: The Joint Declaration supposedly resolves the conflict which originally led to what movement?
What two groups originally signed the Joint Declaration?

answers.text: Lutheran World Federation and Catholic Church

context: In 1999, the representatives of <a4_0>Lutheran World Federation and Catholic Church<a4_0/> signed <a0_0>the Joint Declaration on the Doctrine of Justification<a0_0/>, apparently resolving the conflict over the nature of justification which was at the root of <a3_0>the Protestant Reformation<a3_0/>, although <a1_0>Confessional Lutherans<a1_0/> reject this statement. This is understandable, since there is no compelling authority within them. On 18 July 2006, <a2_0>delegates to the World Methodist Conference<a2_0/> voted unanimously to adopt the Joint Declaration.
